title: [Bug][Docs]: Upgrading from v5 sidebar overlapping with content at horizontal scroll
body:
### What version of React Router are you using?

6.4.3(main)

### Steps to Reproduce

On the "Upgrading from v5" page on the documentation for version 6.4.3 (main), upon horizontal scrolling, the content and the left sidebar overlapped. Moreover, the right sidebar requires scrolling to be fully visible when viewport width is narrower.  

I am using Google Chrome Version 107.0.5304.87 (Official Build) (arm64).

"Upgrading from v5" page with right sidebar missing
![Screenshot 2022-11-02 at 21 26 54](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/100734684/199647570-679bcee9-077a-4143-8b6f-44a71ea78cad.png)

"Upgrading from v5" page with content overlapping
![Screenshot 2022-11-02 at 21 27 01](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/100734684/199647575-530b9a82-e377-44a4-88c7-c9d039cbbfb5.png)


### Expected Behavior

Referencing the "Main Concept" page, the sidebars should be clearly visible at all times and contents should not overlap one another. 

"Main Concept"  page at same viewport as screenshots of "Upgrading from v5"
![Screenshot 2022-11-02 at 21 25 53](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/100734684/199647588-c8375480-4e87-49f2-806f-c60195234820.png)

"Main Concept" page with horizontal scrolling
![Screenshot 2022-11-02 at 21 28 00](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/100734684/199647671-b0efc0c1-ee03-47ed-9ceb-6f05508bad08.png)


### Actual Behavior

The left sidebar is fixed but overlapped with everything from the right when horizontally scrolling. The right sidebar is not fully visible if viewport is not large enough.
